actors.name: Client
actors.description: The client is a leading consulting firm that offers strategic advisory services to businesses across various industries, specializing in growth strategies, market analysis, and operational efficiency.

actors.name: Consultant
actors.description: A consultant is an expert who works closely with clients to develop customized solutions that drive business success, providing high-level strategic guidance and implementation support.

actors.name: System Administrator
actors.description: The system administrator is responsible for managing and maintaining the target system, ensuring its stability, security, and performance, and providing technical support to users.

actors.description: The user is an individual who interacts with the target system to access its features and functionality, potentially including clients, consultants, and other stakeholders.

overview.content:
The following information was provided to Cognitive Architect to generate the architecture with various artifacts. Generated by AI using Llama3.3 70b Instruct on 2025-09-08T08:20:00.833Z

Client Name:
The client name is Z. Z is a leading consulting firm that offers strategic advisory services to businesses across various industries. They specialize in growth strategies, market analysis, and operational efficiency. Z's team of experts works closely with clients to develop customized solutions that drive business success. The company operates in the consulting industry, providing high-level strategic guidance and implementation support. Consulting

Target System Name:
The target system is 2. 2
oh yeah
User of the Target System:

  1. 2 : 2

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Security
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of client data, complying with industry standards and regulations, such as GDPR and HIPAA.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Scalability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should be able to handle increased traffic and user growth without significant performance degradation, with the ability to scale up or down as needed.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Usability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should provide an intuitive and user-friendly interface, with clear navigation and minimal cognitive load, to ensure a positive user experience.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Availability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should be available and accessible to users at all times, with a minimum uptime of 99.9% and prompt notification of scheduled maintenance or downtime.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Maintainability
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should be designed to facilitate easy maintenance, updates, and repairs, with clear documentation and minimal downtime.

nonFunctionalRequirements.name: Regulatory Compliance
nonFunctionalRequirements.description: The system should comply with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards, such as data protection and accessibility guidelines.

actors.name: User
actors.description: The user is an individual who interacts with the target system to access its features and functionality, potentially including clients, consultants, and other stakeholders.

actors.name: System Administrator
actors.description: The system administrator is responsible for managing and maintaining the target system, ensuring its stability, security, and performance, and providing technical support to users.

architecturalDecisions.name: Authentication Mechanism
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should implement a secure user authentication mechanism to verify user identities and authorize access to system resources

alternatives.name: OAuth 2.0
alternatives.description: An industry-standard authorization framework that provides secure access to system resources

alternatives.name: OpenID Connect
alternatives.description: An identity layer on top of the OAuth 2.0 protocol that provides authentication and authorization capabilities

architecturalDecisions.name: Data Storage
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should store client data securely and ensure its confidentiality, integrity, and availability

alternatives.name: NoSQL Database Management System
alternatives.description: A flexible database management system that provides scalable and high-performance data storage and querying capabilities

alternatives.name: Relational Database Management System
alternatives.description: A traditional database management system that provides structured data storage and querying capabilities

architecturalDecisions.alnames:
1. NoSQL Database Management System
2. Relational Database Management System

architecturalDecisions.name: Scalability Approach
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should be designed to scale horizontally and vertically to accommodate growing client bases and increasing data volumes

alternatives.name: Horizontal Scaling
alternatives.description: Adding more servers or instances to the system to increase its capacity and handle growing workloads

alternatives.name: Vertical Scaling
alternatives.description: Upgrading the system's hardware or resources to increase its capacity and handle growing workloads

architecturalDecisions.name: Security Framework
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should implement robust security measures to protect against cyber threats and unauthorized access

alternatives.name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
alternatives.description: A comprehensive security framework that provides guidelines and best practices for managing and reducing cybersecurity risk

alternatives.name: OWASP Security Framework
alternatives.description: A widely-adopted security framework that provides guidelines and best practices for secure system development

architecturalDecisions.alnames:
1. NIST Cybersecurity Framework
2. OWASP Security Framework

architecturalDecisions.name: Data Backup and Recovery
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should implement a regular data backup and recovery process to ensure business continuity and minimize data loss

alternatives.name: Full Backup
alternatives.description: A backup approach that involves backing up all the data in the system

alternatives.name: Incremental Backup
alternatives.description: A backup approach that involves backing up only the changes made to the data since the last backup

architecturalDecisions.name: User Interface
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should provide an intuitive and user-friendly interface to ensure a positive user experience

alternatives.name: Mobile Application
alternatives.description: A mobile application that provides access to the system's features and functionality through a mobile device

alternatives.name: Web-Based Interface
alternatives.description: A web-based interface that provides access to the system's features and functionality through a web browser

architecturalDecisions.name: Reporting and Analytics
architecturalDecisions.problemStatement: The system should provide reporting and analytics capabilities to support business decision-making

alternatives.name: Business Intelligence
alternatives.description: A reporting approach that involves using data analysis and reporting tools to support business decision-making

alternatives.name: Data Visualization
alternatives.description: A reporting approach that involves using visual representations of data to support business decision-making

properties.name: Security and Access Control
properties.description: The system should be able to ensure the security and integrity of client data, including access controls, data encryption, and audit logging, to protect sensitive information.

properties.name: Operational Efficiency
properties.description: The system should be able to provide operational efficiency tools and features, including process automation, workflow management, and performance monitoring, to support business success.

properties.name: Customized Solution Development
properties.description: The system should be able to support the development of customized solutions for clients, including requirements gathering, solution design, and implementation planning.

properties.name: Market Analysis
properties.description: The system should be able to provide market analysis tools and features, including data analytics, market research, and trend forecasting, to support strategic advisory services.
